title: You ever look up an ARAM player and see an odd amount of games on Ziggs, Sona, Xerath etc.?
body: Why do we not have all champions unlocked in ARAM specifically to stop a select group of people from consistently abusing the strongest champions in what is supposed to be a game mode whose entire draw is not knowing what you're going to get?

replies.body: Yup a change is necessary. Unlocking all champs would take care of ARAM accounts. And if they don’t want to go that far, I’d take a compromise. What if the pool of champions you can play with is communal to all players (allies and opponents included). Say your opponent owns lux and you don’t, you’ll have the same probability of rolling her as they do. So owning more “aram” dominating champs actually may benefit your opponents. And champions which none of the 10 players own or aren’t free that week don’t get rolled. Boom problem solved. You’re welcome.

And then come the endless dodges when I try to play with my full roster of champions. I've never understood dodging an ARAM. "Weh I didn't get the champ I want in a totally random for fun game mode, waah"

{{sticker:sg-lulu}}

Last night went through 4 champ selects for one ARAM due to dodging, 5 another time.. Really sucks when you get a decent champ then someone dodges.. Get a trash champ, guess what, no one dodges... {{sticker:sg-ahri-1}}

> [{quoted}](name=Ztoka,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cIPE9jEH,comment-id=000400010002,timestamp=2018-03-07T17:13:14.925+0000)
>
> Last night went through 4 champ selects for one ARAM due to dodging, 5 another time.. Really sucks when you get a decent champ then someone dodges.. Get a trash champ, guess what, no one dodges... {{sticker:sg-ahri-1}}

You should be able to lock your champion in to get them for the next lobby if someone dodges. This effect would obviously turn off if the person who dodged was you or on your (premade) team.

The only bad outcome of this to me would be lobby bullying forcing someone to dodge. But I feel like this wouldn't happen too much, and can be a reportable offense depending on the degree of harassment.
They should make dodges in ARAM more punishing. This is somthing I wanted much sooner, even If they didn't implement this.
Yo that's actually genius, you did a smart

As someone who plays solely ARAM (yes, they exist,) more often than not people gun for the longest range champs possible.  There's a reason there's 2 rerolls you can save up.  It might as well say in big bold letters "Break Glass in case of Mordekaiser".

To be fair, I think there's this whole mythos of "poke is king" that everyone angles for. that just *isn't true* for ARAM, and hasn't been for several years. ARAM is actually #LeagueofTanks, specifically Engage Tanks. If one team has a Rakan and a Maokai, the other team has no front line, and the Rakan/Maokai team isn't boosted, ***nothing else in the game matters***.

There's exceptions and naggles, but you can very reliably predict high Elo  arm matches by "which team rolled into fat initiation", which makes me feel weird whenever I see people complaining about shit like Xerath and Ziggs.

~~Sona can go die in a fire though~~

nope, in the top 30, you still have like 12 mages, 7 ADCs and 3 supports, for 5 tanks (3 with poke btw), 3-4 juggernauts-fighters thingies (some of them also with poke).

roughly 80% of the best champions are still poke-ish champions.

of course a team with 5 mages is going to lose to a team with a more balanced team composition like 2 mages 1 adc 1 tank 1 support, but in the same vein, a team with no poke is also going to lose to a team with poke.

Where are you getting this data, and more importantly is it separating for ELO? I specified High ELO for a reason, because. if low ELOs are included then poke gets a huge surge in power because people wear spell magnets and do incredibly stupid shit that poke champs disproportionately exploit. Additionally, the skill cap on "know how to poke" is. a lot lower than the skill cap on "understand how/when to engage".

https://lolalytics.com/aram/worldwide/platinum/plus/champions/

yeah but if you have no poke or waveclear, you lose your inhibitor 7 minutes into the game and from there you just lose the game from being way too far behind, late game fights are a back and forth between both sides, push as a team, win a fight, suicide taking objectives down, the team that respawns first does the same, and thus one team eventually beats on the inhibitor while the other team is still busy grinding towers.

and like you said, the burden of outplay is on the team with the engage, and it's bound to fail at least half the time when both sides are equally skilled, at which point the poke team is simply more likely to win.

btw ziggs isn't just a poke champion, he also 2 shots towers.

Ziggs is overall fairly strong in particular for a couple of reasons, but I'd say he's only above average. I'd also say that you can generally avoid losing your inhibitior by 7 minutes barring extremely abnormal cases. The worst I generally see is losing your first tower.

The "burden of outplay" may be on the team with engage but it's *not* a coin toss on success/failure. A proper engage against an enemy team that can't defend it (once you hit 13-18 minutes and get your tank items) is like playing solitaire, you eventually just hit a point where you W+M1 Pyro your way forward and win.


Also, "Platinum plus" doesn't matter if it's calculating "platinum" by MMR *number* instead of *% of playerbase*, because Plat 5 MMR on SR is 1720, and accounts for a little less than 5% of the SR player base. On ARAM however, the entire MMR system is inflated, in part due to bots, and a lack of soft resetting combined with a lot of people dropping in for 1-9 games.

Therefore, MMR 1720 on ARAM is more like... Silver 2. That's not a great cutoff. If you wanted *real* plat plus that factors for only. the top 5%, you'd want about... 2150 MMR.

[I had to look up and check my data, but it also provides a graph for the mmr curve of everyone as a whole, and that's what's relevant.](https://na.whatismymmr.com/RocketRelm)

platinum isn't silver zzz silver is ~1200 mmr.

ziggs is obnoxious because if you lose only one fight, you lose your entire base, 

for a team that mostly consists of melee champions to win, they have 1) not to lose half their base at the start and 2) be able to win multiple fights in a row past mid game, aka a 100% dive success rate over 3-4 fights, which is unlikely to happen in both cases when both teams know what they are doing.

I know what that website does, I was one of the supporter back then, but it doesn't tell you anything about champions.

another thing that you might overlook, win rates don't only tell you how good or bad champions are, but also how consistent they are and how often they fit the rest of the team composition, a champion like ziggs or maokai or sivir is pretty much always useful no matter what the rest of the team is since they bring so much to the table, whereas for a champion like shen or sejuani to work, you need the rest of the team to fulfil those important tasks that win you games (poke, waveclear, dps etc) which is less likely to happen on average.

>platinum isn't silver zzz silver is ~1200 mmr.

I can't seem to find how lolalytics defines "Plat+ players." Is it "ranked plat or higher on SR;" "the numeric MMR for plat+ on SR, applied to ARAM;" "the percentage of players plat+ on SR, applied to ARAM;" or some other definition? Each of those are significantly different segments of the playerbase. The first is relatively meaningless, as it excludes ARAM-only players. The second option leads to the above issue where "plat+" is actually equivalent to silver-ish. Meanwhile, the third might be useful in this discussion.

> [{quoted}](name=RocketRelm,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cIPE9jEH,comment-id=00070002,timestamp=2018-03-07T08:57:14.258+0000)
>
> To be fair, I think there's this whole mythos of "poke is king" that everyone angles for. that just *isn't true* for ARAM, and hasn't been for several years. ARAM is actually #LeagueofTanks, specifically Engage Tanks. If one team has a Rakan and a Maokai, the other team has no front line, and the Rakan/Maokai team isn't boosted, ***nothing else in the game matters***.
> 
> There's exceptions and naggles, but you can very reliably predict high Elo  arm matches by "which team rolled into fat initiation", which makes me feel weird whenever I see people complaining about shit like Xerath and Ziggs.
> 
> ~~Sona can go die in a fire though~~

Truer words have never been spoken. Most people assume that poke comps are better. Poke comps do better in the first 10 mins, but when the tanks start getting tanky, the momentum totally shifts. Watch out if you're playing against a Sion, Zac or Maokai. Or worse, against all three together lol...
FYI most damage I've ever seen in an ARAM was over 110K and it was a MORD
My first Pentakill on {{champion:82}} was on ARAM..... before he was reworked in the Juggernaut update

They probably don't want to do that because then people would play ARAM more often then SR. It's no secret that this game has gone downhill and they refuse to acknowledge anyone without a Challengers rank or above.... sad stuff Esports has done to Riot Games.

While I do believe ARAM only accounts are a problem, please consider the following. 
ARAM has way more people dodging than any other mode due to someone not liking their comp or champ and people will usually reroll bad ARAM champs but not the strong ones.

> [{quoted}](name=SpecterVonBaren,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cIPE9jEH,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2018-03-07T04:58:00.629+0000)
>
> While I do believe ARAM only accounts are a problem, please consider the following. ARAM has way more people dodging than any other mode due to someone not liking their comp or champ and people will usually reroll bad ARAM champs but not the strong ones.

^this may well be as important if not more important than ARAM accounts in causing ARAM matches to always have the same champions.

Another factor is that ARAM doesn't shuffle: it happens quite often that you roll the same champion 4 times in a row even though you have almost the whole pool unlocked.
(Shuffle would mean that you roll every champion you own exactly once but in a random order; after you rolled everyone, the list re-randomizes)

The way I see it is people dodge because of bad team comps, not because they don't like playing a particular champion. If you play ARAM regularly then you should be more than comfortable in playing a good chunk of the champion pool, but that goes out the window when you roll a horrible team and the other side is likely to have a much better comp than yours because of the chance someone has only the best champions for ARAM. Unlocking every champion in ARAM would reduce dodging because it would lessen the fear that their comp isn't as bad as yours, both sides would have an equal chance of getting bad rolls instead of just the side with less ARAM accounts.
I didn't say we shouldn't make all champs available, I'm pointing out something people tend to overlook on this.

"Team comp doesnt matter, what matters is player skill"

"eww im  playing udyr" *dodge*
ARAM only accounts are just sad tbh
It's unfortunate that you can't check the amount of times a player has dodged, otherwise I'm fairly certain you'll see a very high ratio between games dodged and games queue'd while you're at it.
Yeah fuck those people, they're taking advantage of the system to optimize the fun out of the game for everyone else.

Unlock rewards for unowned champs and I'd be ok w/ it. 
I don't see it fixing anything though. Unlocking all champs would make for more dodges because you still will get a ton of people who won't play anything in aram other than {{champion:22}} {{champion:142}} {{champion:115}}  etc.. You could enforce stiffer penalties but that will just lead to more accounts (for more dodges) and maybe even killing the game mode. 
Don't forget how much money riot generates from smurfs making aram accounts and using rp to unlock champs since unlocking the CHAMPIONS YOU WANT takes forever w/ how stingy BE now is..
That is why old dominion was the most superior fun mod ever existed.

> [{quoted}](name=Agatorion,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cIPE9jEH,comment-id=0015,timestamp=2018-03-07T13:49:36.507+0000)
>
> That is why old dominion was the most superior fun mod ever existed.

I miss Dominion so much 
{{sticker:sg-soraka}}

As someone who owns every champ and plays a ton of ARAM, honestly, I don't see a problem with ARAM in its current state. I feel that any push to try and force players into non dominant champs will force longer queues / more dodges. Having every champ unlocked means 3/5 games I have a reroll. Whereas an Aram account with 20-30 champs on has to play 7-10 games for one reroll.  And they aren't guaranteed to get 'their' champs because of free rotation and such low reroll points per game. The only people who are currently negatively impacted by ARAM accounts are people with small champion pools that are shit for ARAM and honestly who gives a shit about them. Why they playing ARAM in the first place? Scrubs.{{sticker:sg-ezreal}}

I have been asking for this for a very long time but Riot 0 response. **Riot, I will appreciate what ARAM stands for (All Random All Mid) when you unlock all champions for everyone and make it a true random experience. I cannot wait to see all these ARAM accounts raging in the forums.**

Honestly, i dont even care. Let them. Its really not a big deal. If they are gonna go through all that trouble, just for a shoot the shit side mode, id say they go ahead.
Not like it gets em LP
The problem with opening all championin ARAM is ARAM only players will not ever need to buy chamoipion, therefore less likely to buy skins, which leads to a loss of income for Rito.
I feel like the free champion rotation already solves this issue.
Not even close.

Cause riot has to at least attemp to make money and having a mode with all champs would hurt their margins by quite a bit I guess.  I think rotating free champs can at least sorta help prevent people from always getting their champ.

If you want all champions unlocked in ARAM, go play Smite's version of it. All of their Gods are unlocked for it.

Have fun getting all those champions you never played and you have to reroll with their versions of BE and RP!
Inba someone is going to comment about the client not being able to handle it.
I upvote this every time it comes up.
Good idea!

I mean, we have to keep in mind champion trades too. In theory you have 5 chances to get a champion you like in ARAM if you include the possibility of trading with teammates.

I have all of the champions unlocked personally, but if I see a teammate with a champion I like, I will often try to trade for it.

I'm not saying ARAM accounts don't exist, all I'm saying is they are not the only reason you see certain champions played more than others on a seemingly random game mode.

{{sticker:sg-ahri-2}}

This would be great, but at the very least they could make it truly random from your pool of champs. I do own mostly mages, but from all of the champs I own, I don't think I have EVER gotten {{champion:254}} {{champion:98}} {{champion:20}}  and have owned them for years, yet I get {{champion:34}} {{champion:203}} {{champion:163}} {{champion:45}} ALL THE TIME. Sometimes twice in a row. Or like I play anivia, start another match, get dodged out, and get given anivia again. I am perfectly fine with playing most of my champs, so it sucks to get the same few over and over again.
Question is, why they haven't done that already, like years ago? :D

I'll see if I can find it for you, but Riot actually posted about this. The disparity in seeing champs like Lux, Veiger, Ziggs etc. in ARAM is that those are actually just some of the most-owned  champs in the game. The chance that someone will randomly get it is overall higher because more people own those champs than others.

Because tbh, I don't want to play ARAM. I want to play the map, but I only wanna play the few champions that I enjoy. So I make an account with only assassins and fighters, to avoid being put on shit mages and supports.

We said that since the relase of the mode.

One Rioter answered me politely with something like  "we will not change it and just fuck off, stop annoying me", albeit politely.

Riot cares for ARAM only for 2 weeks on winters break when they have to sell their winter skins. Try in ... 8 months and maybe you'll catch a rioter then.

I'd be more worried if they got shit like mao, malph or ornn all the time.

Poke is strong but without frontlinie you're not getting anywhere.

Aram goes poke>tanks early tanks>anythin else starting mid game. After that you're gonna need soms vayne + veigar type of comp to beat them.

Why are you looking at other ppls champs anyway as long as yours is random it's fine.
If soms loser wants to make a seperate account for aram so be it, he'll get good shit all the time.  But you can't expect to bever see a champ in 2 games back to back. I've played multiple back to back thresh/singed aram games using trading/rerols and once pure luck.

Heck, if this is such a problem why don't they just make the free rotation for ARAM be like 20-30 champions, and only allow THOSE champions to be picked from the list, completely removing player owned champions from the list. If having them all unlocked would create problems then only allow so many at a time regardless of if anyone owns them or not.

> [{quoted}](name=Pika Fox,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cIPE9jEH,comment-id=000f,timestamp=2018-03-07T08:29:56.307+0000)
>
> No. I do not want to play champs i dont own or have never played. If its free this week, so be it. But fuck having everything unlocked. And i say this owning most champs in the game.
> 
> Also, queue dodges and rerolls skew your stats greatly. If you reroll or dodge if you dont get a good champ, then chances are pretty good youll get one.
> 
> (Or shyvana. It constantly wants to give me shyvana)

ARAM is meant to be completely random. Getting a champion you own or don't own should not be any sort of factor at all imo. I remember before I owned so many champions I would constantly get ones who I'd never played, and some I would find out I enjoyed a lot, others I'd find out I didn't. It actually caused me to buy some champs back then. Now I've played every champion at least once I'm fairly sure, so it's not the same, but I still feel like above all, it should be random, whether you own or don't own the champion. The mode isn't meant for you to get your favorite picks all the time. It's meant for you to play a random champion in a 5v5 one lane setting.

> [{quoted}](name=RocketRelm,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=cIPE9jEH,comment-id=00070002,timestamp=2018-03-07T08:57:14.258+0000)

ARAM is actually #LeagueofTanks, specifically Engage Tanks. If one team has a Rakan and a Maokai, the other team has no front line, and the Rakan/Maokai team isn't boosted, ***nothing else in the game matters***.

> There's exceptions and naggles, but you can very reliably predict high Elo  arm matches by "which team rolled into fat initiation", which makes me feel weird whenever I see people complaining about shit like Xerath and Ziggs.
>

Just take the strike through out. I'm sure a lot of people feel the same way lol. But yes I definitely feel like supports are really strong in ARAM. I've constantly destroyed people with Nautilus even going full AP, they just can't handle it. Mages though I used to build like an AP bruiser style, before they removed some of the items I used to do so with. Not being able to die while pumping out consistent damage did wonders.
